intro: Wahlenbergia angustifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, bell-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its foliage consists of narrow, linear leaves that are often hairy, and it is known for its ornamental value in gardens. Wahlenbergia angustifolia is a perennial species that is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
